parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the VS measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the VS CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the vital signs were collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of VSPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPERF when implemented on a specific test basis.
fields.label: Vital Signs Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF="Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name (VSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSPERF

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A single date may be collected for all the vital sign measurements when they are performed on the same date. The date of each measurement can also be collected for each measurement using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSDAT. The date of the measurements may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Vital Signs Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the measurement(s)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: A single collection time (e.g., VSTIM) may be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSTIM.
fields.label: Vital Signs Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the measurement(s)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the vital signs category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Vital Signs
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the vital signs?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the vital signs subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VSSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSGRPID

fields.completionInstructions: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.
fields.implementationNotes: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on the same horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Vital Signs Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VSGRPID
fields.questionText: What is the vital signs group identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSTPT

self.title: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for vital signs, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header. The planned time point of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSTPT.
fields.label: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSTPT
fields.questionText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSSTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
fields.implementationNotes: A single "Not Done" can be collected once for all the tests on the same horizontal record using VSSTAT. The value of VSSTAT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, for each test "NOT DONE" may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT.
fields.label: Vital Signs Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT
fields.questionText: Indicate if the [VSTEST] measurement was not done

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: VS Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] e.g., SYSBP or [TESTCD]_VSORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the VS test code e.g., SYSBP_VSORRES. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: VS Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. In addition to the SDTMIG variable VSORRES, create VSTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of VSTEST from VSTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the VSTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the [VSTEST] measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66770

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: A single Unit field can be collected once for all measurements collected on the same horizontal record using VSUNIT. The value of VSUNIT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed for each measurement, unit may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT. Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.
fields.label: VS Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the [VSTEST] measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether vital sign result was clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the vital signs results were clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: In horizontal data collection, a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSCLSIG may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF if needed.
fields.label: Vital Signs Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM = "VSCLSIG" and SUPPVS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSCLSIG

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78431

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSPOS

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g. SITTING).
fields.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPOS may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.
fields.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSPOS
fields.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the [VSTEST] measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. In horizontal data collection, a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSLOC may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the [VSTEST] measurement was taken?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Vital Signs Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [VSTEST] measurement?
